coded_answer.p: I am writing to complain about the musical show:, Over the Rainbow, presented in your theatre on 15th of June.

I went to the theatre to buy the ticket and expected to haveget a discount as I was a student. However, the salesman in the box office told me the discount tickets had been soldsold out. I could not understand why but I still bought the ticket because I was crazy about Danny Brook. Then, I went into the theatre on time but became a little bit angry forafter waiting until 20:15, forty-five minutes after the expected starting time. Furthermore, I was so disappointed to find out that Danny Brook was not on the stage and the leading actor sang so badbadly that I left the theatre before it finished. At lastLast, I went to the theatre restaurant but it was closed because it needed cleaning.
I think it was definitely not athe perfect evening as garenteedguaranteed in your advertisement. I look forward to having a full refund in the very near future as I did not enjoy it at all.

A week later, when I was still in a bad mood, my form teacher, Mrs Brown, talked about jobs in our English lesson. She told us there were numerous types of job in the world. Some offered a high salary while some did not. However, they are equalequally important for our society. 'Who wants to be a doctor?' She asked. Many students raised their hands. 'Who wants to be a lawyer?' Again, many students put up their hand. But when she asked who wanted to be a cleaner, nobody raised his hand and I felt so shamefulashamed that I lowered my head. 'Cleaner is a very good job.' Mrs Brown said within a loud voice. 'If there were no cleanercleaners, who would clean the school for us, who? Who would keep the environment nice and tidy.?'
